titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms1940-005

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Account books of general mercantile business in Draper (Pulaski County), Virginia during the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Draper Mercantile Account Books must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Draper Mercantile Company Account Books, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Draper Mercantile Account Books were donated to Special Collections prior to 1941.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Draper Mercantile Account Books commenced and was completed in October, 2012.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: According to the current incarnation of the business, the original Draper Mercantile was founded by E. G. Gannaway, G. H. Gilmer, E. T. Pratt, and J. H. Pratt, who ran the store as a partnership until 1944, when Gannaway’s sons, G. Gilmer and Lawrence C., bought out the Pratt and Gilmer interests and operated the business until 1979. In addition to its offerings in general merchandise, the store at times housed a blacksmith, barbershop, millinery, dress shop, and the local post office.

Ownership passed through several hands in the following decades, with the building becoming home to a furniture store and, later, an antiques dealership. In 2008, Debbie and Bill Gardner purchased the store and reopened it as the Draper Mercantile and Trading Company, returning the store to its original purpose but with a focus on locally produced goods.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains ledgers of the Draper Mercantile Company, a general store and associated enterprises operating in Draper (Pulaski County) from the late 19th century through the late 20th century. Included are two store ledgers, detailing customer names, transaction dates, and goods purchased. The collection also includes a day book maintained by the Bank of Draper, providing customer names and transaction amounts.
